data.title: Mike Wallace Biography
data.meta_description: Read all about Mike Wallace with TV Guide's exclusive biography including their list of awards, celeb facts and more at TV Guide.
data.text:
Fast Facts

Went to grammar school with John F

Kennedy in Brookline, MA

Worked as an announcer for a radio station in Grand Rapids, MI, in 1939

Did commercials for the radio shows The Green Hornet and Secret Agent

Acted in the Broadway play Reclining Figure in 1954

Was the host of several TV game shows in the 1950s

Turned down an offer to become Richard Nixon's press secretary after covering the 1968 GOP convention

Received a Lifetime Achievement Emmy in 2003 (to go with his 19 News Emmys); was inducted into the Television Academy Hall of Fame in 1991

Conducted his last interview for 60 Minutes with baseball player Roger Clemens in 2008
